This is awesome \m/

I'm having problems finding the localhost and broadcasthost, how exactly do you paste the activation blockers in them?

I'm a noob at this stuff so excuse me
Thank you :D

Here you go :) 

##
# Host Database
#
# localhost is used to configure the loopback interface
# when the system is booting.  Do not change this entry.
##
127.0.0.1	localhost
255.255.255.255	broadcasthost
::1             localhost 
fe80::1%lo0	localhost

# Block Adobe Activation
127.0.0.1 hl2rcv.adobe.com                                                      
 127.0.0.1 t3dns.adobe.com                                                       
 127.0.0.1 3dns-1.adobe.com                                                      
 127.0.0.1 3dns-2.adobe.com                                                      
 127.0.0.1 3dns-3.adobe.com                                                      
 127.0.0.1 3dns-4.adobe.com                                                      
 127.0.0.1 activate.adobe.com                                                   
 127.0.0.1 activate-sea.adobe.com                                                
 127.0.0.1 activate-sjc0.adobe.com                                               
 127.0.0.1 activate.wip.adobe.com                                                
 127.0.0.1 activate.wip1.adobe.com                                               
 127.0.0.1 activate.wip2.adobe.com                                               
 127.0.0.1 activate.wip3.adobe.com                                     
 127.0.0.1 activate.wip4.adobe.com                                               
 127.0.0.1 adobe-dns.adobe.com                                                   
 127.0.0.1 adobe-dns-1.adobe.com                                         
 127.0.0.1 adobe-dns-2.adobe.com                                                 
 127.0.0.1 adobe-dns-3.adobe.com                                                 
 127.0.0.1 adobe-dns-4.adobe.com                                                 
 127.0.0.1 ood.opsource.net                                                      
 127.0.0.1 practivate.adobe                                              
 127.0.0.1 practivate.adobe.com                                                  
 127.0.0.1 tpractivate.adobe.newoa                                               
 127.0.0.1 practivate.adobe.ntp                                                  
 127.0.0.1 practivate.adobe.ipp                                                  
 127.0.0.1 ereg.adobe.com                                                        
 127.0.0.1 ereg.wip.adobe.com                                                    
 127.0.0.1 ereg.wip1.adobe.com                                                   
 127.0.0.1 ereg.wip2.adobe.com                                                   
 127.0.0.1 ereg.wip3.adobe.com                                                   
 127.0.0.1 ereg.wip4.adobe.com                                                   
 127.0.0.1 wip.adobe.com                                                         
 127.0.0.1 wip1.adobe.com                                                        
 127.0.0.1 wip2.adobe.com                                                        
 127.0.0.1 wip3.adobe.com                                                        
 127.0.0.1 wip4.adobe.com                                                        
 127.0.0.1 www.wip.adobe.com                                                     
 127.0.0.1 www.wip1.adobe.com                                                    
 127.0.0.1 www.wip2.adobe.com                                    
 127.0.0.1 www.wip3.adobe.com                                                    
 127.0.0.1 www.wip4.adobe.com                                                    
 127.0.0.1 wwis-dubc1-vip60.adobe.com

I feel really stupid here but I'm having trouble understanding the instructions.  As I understand it, after installing and before opening, I open terminal and paste "sudo /Applications/TextEdit.app/Contents/MacOS/TextEdit /etc/hosts"  

Am I supposed to press enter after this?  

Then, for the activation blocker info, it says paste between Localhost and broadcast host but I don't see those anywhere.  Is that still while in Terminal?

Finally, in step 8 it says to run Photoshop and enter Serial.  Is that supposed to be lightroom?  

I know others have done this with no problems and so this is really my issue but any help would be appreciated.

Thanks!

ok, I read more comments and think I did everything right but as a couple of others mentioned, I'm getting this "2011-08-13 13:17:31.357 TextEdit[25841:1907] PersistentUI: LSSharedFileListInsertItemURL() failed at inserting URL file://localhost/etc/hosts" after many lines about error loading.  I am on Lion as well.  This is all for blocking adobe right so if I've got snitch installed and already blocked adobe for photoshop, I don't really need to do this do I?

For those of you having trouble on Lion, paste the following in step 4 instead: 
sudo pico /etc/hosts


All other steps are the same. 

When prompted for a password, enter your admin password (the same one you use to install other programs on your computer).

Thanks for the great download!!!

Thanks, worked like a charm! Don't know how that works, but it did what it was supposed to, haha.

Hello, hope You guys can help me.
I just bought an Imac 21 and am trying to install PS Lightroom, I made exactly every step till step 3, in step 4 I Openend Terminal and did paste the two options (sudo /Applications/TextEdit.app/Contents/MacOS/TextEdit /etc/hosts and sudo pico /etc/hosts), the second options is told to be right for LION users (wich I am), but after pasting I can not write my password, the blinking mark gets a grey color and I can not wirte or even paste text.
Any sugestions?
Hey Cyberpiraten great job uploading this and other releases.

works perfect, much easier than I thought when looking at the instructions. The Lion code worked too.

For those as clueless as I was, the "terminal application" is in your Mac utilities folder and opens up a DOS like prompt.

When it asks you for a password in the Terminal application, just type it in -- it doesn't show your typing - at first I thought it wasn't working, and got an error message, but then i just typed in the password and hit enter and it worked.

I chose the second to last serial number and it worked.

Also, once installed, the program automatically updated to the current LR version.

http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6802136/Adobe.Lightroom.3.5.MacOSX.Incl.Keymaker

Works well, just up'd it

at step 4 it asks for password, but i cant type anything..what to do

For Adobe CS5.5 the host file is changed into this:


##
# Host Database
#
# localhost is used to configure the loopback interface
# when the system is booting.  Do not change this entry.
##
0.0.0.0	localhost
255.255.255.255	broadcasthost
::1             localhost 
fe80::1%lo0	localhost

# block Adobe activation servers
0.0.0.0	3dns-2.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	3dns-3.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	activate.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	activate-sea.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	activate-sjc0.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	adobe-dns.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	adobe-dns-2.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	adobe-dns-3.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	ereg.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	hl2rcv.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	practivate.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	wip3.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	activate.wip3.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	ereg.wip3.adobe.com
0.0.0.0	wwis-dubc1-vip60.adobe.com


Does this work for Lightroom 3.3 or should I add the 127.0.0.1 localhost and the rest of the blockers?
